oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practical BLV eradication measures for commercial dairy farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Niles, Don
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine leukosis
eradication
screening test
confirmatory test
biosecurity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The presentation is intended to provide the dairy veterinarian with a process by which Bovine Leukemia Virus (BLV) can be eradicated from a dairy herd. The article will cover both bios­ecurity measures to limit horizontal transfer of BLV within a herd as well as testing procedures to identify BLV positive ani­mals and sort by their likelihood of infecting others in the herd. There will also be a discussion as to why BLV-free status may become more desirable in our modern society, and how the large animal veterinarian is well positioned to lead eradication efforts.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 68-71
